ivardefs.name: basedOn_
ivardefs.desc: A reference to a resource that contains details of the request for this procedure.

ivardefs.name: bodySite_
ivardefs.desc: Detailed and structured anatomical location information. Multiple locations are allowed - e.g. multiple punch biopsies of a lesion.

ivardefs.name: category_
ivardefs.desc: A code that classifies the procedure for searching, sorting and display purposes (e.g. "Surgical Procedure").

ivardefs.name: code
ivardefs.desc: The specific procedure that is performed. Use text if the exact nature of the procedure cannot be coded (e.g. "Laparoscopic Appendectomy").

ivardefs.name: complicationDetail_
ivardefs.desc: Any complications that occurred during the procedure, or in the immediate post-performance period.

ivardefs.name: complication_
ivardefs.desc: Any complications that occurred during the procedure, or in the immediate post-performance period. These are generally tracked separately from the notes, which will typically describe the procedure itself rather than any 'post procedure' issues.

ivardefs.name: encounter
ivardefs.desc: The Encounter during which this Procedure was created or performed or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.

ivardefs.name: focalDevice_
ivardefs.desc: A device that is implanted, removed or otherwise manipulated (calibration, battery replacement, fitting a prosthesis, attaching a wound-vac, etc.) as a focal portion of the Procedure.

ivardefs.name: followUp_
ivardefs.desc: If the procedure required specific follow up - e.g. removal of sutures. The follow up may be represented as a simple note or could potentially be more complex, in which case the CarePlan resource can be used.

ivardefs.name: identifier_
ivardefs.desc: Business identifiers assigned to this procedure by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and is propagated from server to server.

ivardefs.name: instantiatesCanonical_
ivardefs.desc: The URL pointing to a FHIR-defined protocol, guideline, order set or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this Procedure.

ivardefs.name: instantiatesUri_
ivardefs.desc: The URL pointing to an externally maintained protocol, guideline, order set or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this Procedure.

ivardefs.name: location
ivardefs.desc: The location where the procedure actually happened.  E.g. a newborn at home, a tracheostomy at a restaurant.

ivardefs.name: note_
ivardefs.desc: Any other notes and comments about the procedure.

ivardefs.name: outcome
ivardefs.desc: The outcome of the procedure - did it resolve the reasons for the procedure being performed?

ivardefs.name: partOf_
ivardefs.desc: A larger event of which this particular procedure is a component or step.

ivardefs.name: performer_
ivardefs.desc: Limited to "real" people rather than equipment.

ivardefs.name: reasonCode_
ivardefs.desc: The coded reason why the procedure was performed. This may be a coded entity of some type, or may simply be present as text.

ivardefs.name: reasonReference_
ivardefs.desc: The justification of why the procedure was performed.

ivardefs.name: recorded
ivardefs.desc: The date the occurrence of the procedure was first captured in the record - potentially significantly after the occurrence of the event.

ivardefs.name: recorder
ivardefs.desc: Individual who recorded the record and takes responsibility for its content.

ivardefs.name: report_
ivardefs.desc: This could be a histology result, pathology report, surgical report, etc.

ivardefs.name: status
ivardefs.desc: A code specifying the state of the procedure. Generally, this will be the in-progress or completed state.

ivardefs.name: statusReason
ivardefs.desc: Captures the reason for the current state of the procedure.

ivardefs.name: subject
ivardefs.desc: The person, animal or group on which the procedure was performed.

ivardefs.name: usedCode_
ivardefs.desc: Identifies coded items that were used as part of the procedure.

ivardefs.name: usedReference_
ivardefs.desc: Identifies medications, devices and any other substance used as part of the procedure.

properties.desc: An action that is or was performed on or for a patient. This can be a physical intervention like an operation, or less invasive like long term services, counseling, or hypnotherapy.
